intro: Pavetta zeyheri var. brevituba, commonly known as the narrow-tubed pavetta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in terminal umbels. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
